overview: Students studying French, German, Italian or Spanish in the Bachelor of Arts (Honours) or Graduate Diploma in Arts (Advanced) are permitted to take this individual reading subject subject to coordinator authorisation to enrol. After consultation with an appropriate member of staff who agrees to act as a supervisor, students wishing to take this subject should submit to the coordinator details of their proposed topic for approval. On completion of the subject students should be able to demonstrate in-depth knowledge of a particular topic in their chosen language.
ilo: Be able to demonstrate in-depth knowledge of a particular topic in Italian, French, German, Spanish or Russian culture and linguistics, and demonstrate the ability to analyse and to report on their reading in a manner appropriate to the methodology adopted.
generic_skills: Be able to carry out research at an advanced level independently
Be able to apply theoretical knowledge in the analysis of literary texts or linguistic phenomena
Be able to structure and express clearly complex intellectual arguments.

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Two essays, worth 50% each or equivalent
assessment.timing: Deadlines to be negotiated with coordinator

assessment.hurdle: 1. Attendance hurdle requirement: Students are required to attend a minimum of 80% of supervision meetings in order to qualify to have their written work assessed.

2. Late Penalty and Assessment hurdle requirement: Assessment submitted late without an approved extension will be penalised at five per cent (5%) of the possible marks available for the assessment task per day or part thereof. All pieces of assessment must be submitted to pass the subject. Each submitted assessment must be complete, constitute a genuine attempt to address the requirements of the task and will not be accepted after 20 University business days from the original assessment due date without written approval.

date_times.contact_hours: Regular, documented consultations over the semester with the supervisor(s) as arranged. Meetings should normally occur at least fortnightly and should be at least of half an hour duration.
